title: New stablecoin stumbles as Binance's Changpeng Zhao hints at unstable stables - CoinGeek
content:
The new First Digital USD (FDUSD) stablecoin’s debut was anything but auspicious, while cryptic comments by Binance’s founder about stablecoin stability have left the ‘crypto’ sector bracing for impact.

On Wednesday, July 26, the Hong Kong-based First Digital Group celebrated the debut and listing of its new FDUSD stablecoin on Binance, the world’s largest digital asset exchange by trading volume. But the U.S. dollar-backed FDUSD appears to have tripped down the red carpet.

Within moments of FDUSD’s debut, Binance abruptly announced that it had “postponed” the listing due to “FDUSD Pairs’ liquidity providers experiencing technical issues.” Binance said it decided to “halt trading … and cancel all pending orders on FDUSD, to ensure utmost protection for our users.” Binance pledged to restart FDUSD trading later that same day.

At the time of its scheduled debut, FDUSD was only transactable on Ethereum and the Binance Smart Chain (BSC aka BNB Smart Chain). Only a tiny sliver of the initial 10.11 million tokens was being held outside Binance wallet addresses.

Binance offers a ‘zero maker fee’ promotion for customers trading FDUSD for either Binance’s in-house BNB token, the formerly Binance-backed BUSD stablecoin, or Tether (USDT). Binance also added FDUSD to its Binance Convert feature, allowing users to trade FDUSD for other tokens, including BTC and ETH, plus various fiat currencies.

When it first announced its stablecoin plans, First Digital claimed it was in discussions with all major exchanges regarding possible listings, but Binance founder Changpeng ‘CZ’ Zhao is so far the only one to take the FDUSD bait.

First Digital Group claims FDUSD—issued by a First Digital subsidiary called FD121 Limited—is “1:1 backed with high-quality cash and cash equivalent reserves, which are held in segregated accounts in regulated financial institutions and are monitored and audited by independent third parties.” The statement went on to qualify that “FDUSD is intended to be redeemable 1:1 for equal value in U.S. dollars.”

First Digital Group includes First Digital Trust, a Hong Kong-registered custodian whose CEO Vincent Chok declared that FDUSD “offers a transparent, reliable and trusted alternative that provides the predictability corporates and investors are demanding.”

Well, maybe. First Digital is/was a major custodian of the assets (allegedly) backing the TUSD stablecoin. The custodial choices of TrueUSD—the company behind TUSD—haven’t always been inspiring, as they included not only the recently insolvent Nevada-based Prime Trust but also Silvergate Bank and Signature Bank. The latter two collapsed spectacularly earlier this year as ‘crypto winter’ froze their assets off.

TrueUSD stopped sharing its custodial numeric allocations shortly after it was acquired by Techteryx, a murky Asian entity that insists it totally isn’t a beard for Tron founder Justin Sun, just as the Huobi exchange insists equally loudly that it, too, has nothing to do with Sun.

By late Wednesday, CoinGecko data showed more than three-quarters of all FDUSD trading volume on Binance was for USDT, while the FDUSD-BNB pair accounted for a mere 1%. So, trading one stablecoin for another…Bullish?

Stumblecoins

The stablecoin sector has had a tumultuous year. TUSD more than quadrupled its cap to over $3.1 billion, although that’s since dropped back slightly to $2.8 billion. Like FDUSD, TUSD was extended ‘zero trading fee’ incentives after Binance was forcibly ousted from its BUSD partnership with New York-based Paxos Trust.

The New York Attorney General forced the pair to separate this spring after concluding that Binance was transacting in a version of BUSD it called Binance-Peg BUSD on its own BSC network and that on multiple occasions, there were more than a billion B-Peg BUSD circulating that weren’t backed by any reserve assets. From a peak of $23.5 billion last November, less than $3.8 billion BUSD is currently left in the wild.

Before this decoupling, CZ had begun forcibly converting Binance customers’ USDC to BUSD in September 2022. This was largely viewed as an anti-competitive push to diminish USDC, which was beginning to challenge Tether’s market share dominance at the time.

USDC is run by a consortium involving Circle and U.S. exchange Coinbase (NASDAQ: COIN). USDC has since seen its market cap plummet by more than one-half from its mid-2022 peak of over $56 billion to its current sum of $26.5 billion. Over that same period, market leader Tether has added over $25 billion to its cap, which currently sits at nearly $84 billion.

Even before the collapse of rival exchange FTX, Binance was among the largest recipients of Tether, despite CZ likening Tether to “a black box” for its refusal to submit to an audit of its billions of alleged reserves. CZ also expressed doubts that Tether would have the capacity to convert all USDT on a 1:1 basis with the U.S. dollar should push come to shove.

And that pushing and shoving may be just around the corner.

There’s some lovely filth down here

Unlike Tether’s black box, CZ has been likened to an open book, at least in terms of his willingness to bend/break the rules to pad Binance’s bottom line.

But with Binance increasingly unwelcome in markets around the world—Binance withdrew its German license application this week—and trad-fi partners looking to avoid guilty-by-association, there’s mounting suspicion that Binance’s efforts to promote certain stablecoins over others are intended to create a walled garden in which actual dollars flow in but rarely need to flow out.

The day before FDUSD’s launch, a cryptic tweet from CZ claimed that “‘stable’ coins… are not always stable.” CZ followed up on Wednesday by tweeting that the BTC token “is more stable than stable coins now…”

For all we know, CZ is just messing with peoples’ heads, but there are several external forces here that may be coming to a head.

For one, the U.S. Department of Justice is prepping serious criminal charges against both Binance and CZ and the fact that disgraced FTX founder Sam Bankman-Fried (SBF) was recently spotted hanging around the DoJ’s New York offices—nearly a week before a hastily scheduled court appearance on his own criminal case—adds more fuel to that fire.

CZ was an original investor in FTX before SBF forcibly bought out CZ’s stake in mid-2021. At the time, SBF was trying to craft a regulatory-friendly image around his own criminal empire, and CZ’s criminal rep wasn’t helping. But with CZ having administered the coup de grace that led to FTX’s demise, SBF might be about to use his intimate understanding of Binance’s operations for a slice of best-served cold revenge.

If SBF is getting ready to flip on CZ to save his own skin, that could leave CZ with only one card left to play in his own negotiations with the DoJ: flipping on Tether. There’s no honor among these thieves, and with the DoJ already having a variety of potential criminal charges it could file against Tether—and SBF could potentially fink on both Binance and Tether—CZ better bring the goods and bring ‘em quick.

If CZ’s not asking his lawyers to at least explore his options in this area, perhaps ‘unstable’ isn’t an attribute limited to tokens.

Follow CoinGeek’s Crypto Crime Cartel series, which delves into the stream of groups—from BitMEX to Binance, Bitcoin.com, Blockstream, ShapeShift, Coinbase, Ripple,

Ethereum, FTX and Tether—who have co-opted the digital asset revolution and turned the industry into a minefield for naïve (and even experienced) players in the market.

New to blockchain? Check out CoinGeek’s Blockchain for Beginners section, the ultimate resource guide to learn more about blockchain technology.

title: Baby Doge Coin Integrates opBNB Testnet with the Aim of Scalability and Speed Improvements for BABYDOGE - CoinCodex
content:
Key Takeaways:

Baby DogeCoin announces support for opBNB Testnet

opBNB is a layer-2 scalability solution for BNB Chain that could drastically improve the blockchain’s performance

The full launch of opBNB layer-2 has yet to be announced

Baby DogeCoin (BABYDOGE) has announced that it has integrated opBNB Testnet to deliver improved blockchain performance for apps that are built on the network. opBNB, a layer-2 scalability solution for BNB Chain that uses optimistic rollups to process transactions, is expected to usher in a new era of enhanced scalability for the blockchain.

? Exciting news! ? BabyDoge has integrated #opBNB testnet for #BabyDogeCoin.



Looking forward to a new chapter in scalability, speed, and reduced gas fees with our friends at @BNBCHAIN ?#BabyDogeArmy #BabyDogeSwap #BNBChain pic.twitter.com/adNMz18Czw — Baby Doge (@BabyDogeCoin) July 26, 2023

opBNB remains in its early phases of development. Baby DogeCoin’s integration with the testnet could enable a vastly superior number of transactions per second by the time the full launch of opBNB takes place.

What is Baby DogeCoin?

Baby DogeCoin is a Dogecoin-inspired meme coin built on BNB Chain. It is a community-driven project that has a unique burning mechanism designed to make BABYDOGE become increasingly scarce over time. A percentage of each transaction is automatically burned, which continually reduces the number of BABYDOGE tokens in circulation and contributes towards price appreciation.

Baby Doge Coin also launched a Burn Portal in early-2023, which enables token holders to manually contribute towards the auto-burn mechanism by sending BABYDOGE tokens to a defunct crypto address.

On top of its deflationary tokenomics, BABYDOGE token holders receive financial rewards each time a transaction takes place. 5% of all transaction value is airdropped proportionally to wallets that own BABYDOGE, which provides consistent passive income for all members of the Baby Doge Coin community.

How will opBNB improve efficiency for Baby DogeCoin?

As a layer-2 scalability solution for BNB Chain, opBNB can bring improved transaction processing speeds and higher throughput for all user interactions. Since Baby DogeCoin is a BEP-20 token, it is native to BNB Chain, and all opBNB-based BABYDOGE transactions will benefit from these performance enhancements.

Optimistic rollups are used to process a higher number of transactions without the need to achieve consensus for each one. They reduce strain on BNB Chain’s underlying layer-1, which makes transactions cheaper, boosts throughput, and makes the entire process of interacting with the blockchain much faster.

Baby DogeCoin token holders will be able to transact on a much more efficient blockchain network thanks to the project’s integration with opBNB Testnet. opBNB can process over 4000 transactions per second (TPS), a significant upgrade to Binance Smart Chain’s 160 TPS, with an average fee of just $0.005.

When will opBNB layer-2 launch?

As stated, opBNB remains in its testnet phase. The full launch of opBNB layer-2 has yet to be announced, with dApps in the ecosystem being encouraged to integrate with the testnet to fix any bugs before a full launch date has been set. This can help to iron out any possible security issues and ensure that opBNB layer-2 performs as planned by the time it goes live to the public.

Baby DogeCoin price prediction

BABYDOGE is currently valued at $0.0000000012 per token. The CoinCodex price prediction algorithm anticipates that BABYDOGE will climb to $0.000000001317 in the next 30 days.

title: The Best Airbnbs In Perth For Every Type Of Stay - Urban List
content:
Whether you’re new in town or looking to spruce up your next city staycation, you’ll want to hang around for these amazing Airbnbs. From whimsical treehouses with stained glass windows to panoramic coastal penthouses, we have your next Perth adventure covered.

Where To Stay In Perth?

Perth stretches pretty far north and south, so we'll forgive you for being a little unsure about where to stay if it's your first time. To help you out, we've rounded up plenty of options to suit every type of stay.

Perth CBD and Northbridge—For easy access to the best dining, nightlife and cultural experiences, a central stay in the CBD or Northbridge is what you're after.

Fremantle—Think of Fremantle (or Freo) as Perth's second CBD, but with a much more eclectic and relaxed vibe. It's home to some of the best eating and drinking holes, plus cool boutiques, second-hand stores, art galleries and music venues. Plus, it's just a half hour ferry ride from Rottnest Island.

Inner City—Suburbs like Mount Lawley, Subiaco and Leederville are great places to stay if you're keen to escape the traffic and chaos of the city without going too far. These hubs also happen to be full of incred cafes, restaurants and bars, plus unique retailers and parks too. Just make sure you have a car to get around if you're booking these areas.

Beachside—To make the most of Perth's incredible beaches, you'll obviously wanna book an Airbnb by the coast. Perth's got plenty of stunning beachside burbs, but we'd suggest looking at Scarborough, Cottesloe and South Fremantle if you still want easy access to amazing eats and drinks too.

Perth Hills and Swan Valley—While most of Perth heads down south for holidays, there's also some great stays within an hour of the CBD in the Perth Hills and the Swan Valley—both offer wineries, breweries and a relaxed country vibe without the 3+ hour drive.

Here's our pick of the best Airbnbs in Perth right now.

Perth CBD And Northbridge

Heart Of The City Hideaway

Perth

Heritage charm meets contemporary cool in this light and bright character apartment. Pop on a record and soak up views over the Swan River and Langley Park, then head out to explore the CBD's best—it's all within walking distance.

Terracotta Townhouse

Perth

We're obsessed with how serene this terracotta townhouse looks. Kitted out with unique art pieces, lush plants and timeless furniture as well as two retro bikes for you to use, the aesthetic two storey Airbnb has everything you need for a good stay in Perth's CBD.

Salvation Building

Perth

Appreciate Perth’s long-standing history with this charming heritage home in the heart of the city. This three-level contemporary townhouse is located in the East End inside the historical Salvation Army buildings. Designed by renowned Western Australian architect, Brian Klopper, modern elements contrast beautifully with restored features to create an urban oasis. The CBD, Swan River, entertainment precinct, and public transport are only a short stroll away, making this the perfect stay for an inner city adventure. It’s also pet-friendly so feel free to bring your pooch along too. Book here.

Designer’s Pad

Northbridge

This apartment is the life of the party–no, literally, it’s right in the middle of Northbridge, Perth’s best entertainment precinct. Chic urban design meets the convenience of inner-city living for this designer apartment. Enjoy the vibrance of Northbridge nightlife on your private balcony whilst also getting some rest with triple-glazed windows and block-out blinds–you’ll thank us. Filled with fun pops of colour and thoughtful touches, this pad has everything you could possibly need to explore Perth. Book here.

Fremantle

Heritage Cottage

Fremantle

This pet-friendly Heritage cottage in Fremantle has been restored and refreshed to showcase its best features, including original jarrah floors and embellished ceiling roses while giving it a more modern, livable feel. Location, location, location is the real winner for this stay. Surrounded by the best of Freo, you can easily head out and explore with or without your best friend in toe.

Minderoo House

Fremantle

This beautiful Airbnb gives you the opportunity to reside in a classic Fremantle character home with photo-worthy limestone walls, high ceilings and an 1880s-style veranda. The interiors of Minderoo House are modern, but the heritage charm shines through with its stained glass windows and white fireplace. Lounge in the sunroom with a book, have a cuppa outside and soak up the cosy Freo vibes. Book now.

Warehouse West End

Fremantle

New York chic meets historical charm in this renovated apartment in Fremantle’s vibrant West End. This open-plan warehouse is a cool character, with pops of colour, industrial accents and contemporary art peppered throughout the space. The real star of the show is the main courtyard drenched in sunlight and good vibes. A short walk to the charming cafe strip and the beach, make this your next stylish oasis in Fremantle. Book here.

Check out more of the best Fremantle Airbnbs and Fremantle hotels.

Inner City

Parklife

Mount Lawley

We don’t shy away from how much we love Hyde Park, so when this Airbnb listing popped up we couldn’t resist checking it out. Located in Mount Lawley, this retro 60s studio apartment is bursting with leafy green plants, cute knick-knacks, and personalised touches. Hyde Park is just across the road, which is perfect for picnics, coffee dates, jogging or chatting with the cute ducks. Even better, it’s a short stroll to Beaufort Street where some of our favourite bars and eateries are located. Book here.

Delightful Cottage

Subiaco

Subiaco's leafy streets have to be some of the prettiest to hit up with your pooch on a morning walk, especially when you throw in a stop at Community Coffee Co. But the beaut location is just one of the reasons we love this pet-friendly cutie. The charming mint-hued heritage exterior gives way to a renovated delight with an incredible rear deck and garden that screams for an afternoon vino or two before trotting yourself down to Clint Nolan's lush new Mexican joint, La Condesa, for a feed.

Beachside

Neue Blue

Cottesloe

This adults only art-filled apartment is as luxurious as it gets, with unbeatable beachfront views and incredibly stylish interiors that will make you want to move in permanently. When you do finally drag yourself out, you'll be glad to find great cafes, bars, restaurants and boutiques all within a short walk.

Waterfront Panorama

Scarborough

Hit up Perth’s best beaches from this idyllic coastal hideaway in Scarborough. The beach is quite literally at your doorstep, with the sunny Scarborough Beach only a short walk over the sandy dunes. This waterfront property screams coastal chic and effortless charm with its breezy rooms and beachy touches. For those balmy summer evenings, your private balcony and bar offer uninterrupted views of the sun setting over the Indian Ocean–perfect for a crisp glass of wine with friends or family. Book here.

Blue Peter Penthouse

North Coogee

If you’re after sweeping ocean views, then this luxe penthouse apartment in North Coogee is the one for you. Your staycation is more like a resort holiday with a stunning outdoor deck complete with a lounge area, hammock and private spa bath. We encourage you to treat yourself to a chilled glass of wine as you watch the sunset go down on the Indian ocean. Book here.

Blue Treehouse

Cottesloe

For something a bit more quirky and whimsical, how about this handmade treehouse in Cottesloe? You’ll find curiosities at every turn, with the house made entirely of reclaimed and salvage finds to create a sustainable home. Ascend the iron spiral case to enter your relaxing haven. A stained glass window and beautiful Indian shutters open up the space, which includes a double bed, rocking chair and cosy fireplace. During your stay, you’ll have access to the alfresco kitchen, open fireplace and pool hidden amongst a leafy garden. Book here.

Silver Street Studio

South Fremantle

For something unique and full of character, Silver Street Studio in South Fremantle is the romantic retreat of your dreams. This charming icon was once an artist's studio and a gallery before it became the eclectic and rustic space it is today. We won’t go into its history as we want you to discover that for yourself, but we will say it has a turret–so cool. If you can leave the beautiful home for a moment, you’ll find the cafe strip is just around the corner with a short walk to South Beach for a dip. Book here.

Swan Valley And Perth Hills

Treehouse In The Australian Bush

Swan Valley

If you’re looking for a picturesque stay in the Perth Hills close to the Swan Valley winery region, then consider this tranquil treehouse. Immerse yourself in the Australian bush with a stunning Jarrah deck that opens out to sweeping views of the valley. You would be forgiven if your jaw also dropped looking at the entertainment space, including your own private jacuzzi, kitchen, BBQ and a rustic fireplace. Wander down to the backyard for a flip on the trampoline, a perilous trip on the zipline, or a swing amongst the gum trees. The bungalow sleeps 10, making it a perfect family-friendly escape or group getaway. Book here.

Luxury Swan Valley Farm Stay

Swan Valley

It's hard to believe this tranquil farm stay is a mere 20 minutes away from Perth. Head off for morning walks and meet the very friendly alpacas you'll share your stay with. Spend your day exploring the Swan Valley's best wineries and restaurants.

Nestled in Nature

Gooseberry Hill

It’s not every day you get to swim in your own private infinity pool. Well, you can swim and splash around to your heart's content at this amazing Gooseberry Hill Airbnb. Boasting 270˚ degree views of the Swan Coastal Plain and the iconic ZigZag lookout, you won’t want to leave this one-of-a-kind home that sleeps nine. The deck is calling us, with a beautiful outdoor lounge area, BBQ, and pizza oven for your summertime gatherings. Challenge each other to a game on the basketball court or ping pong table. Not convinced yet, the property is only 25 minutes from the Swan Valley wine region, serving as the perfect home base to explore the area. Book here.

Honeysuckle Cottage

Bickley

If you're chasing a getaway near Perth for you and a few fellow pet parents, Honeysuckle Cottage is an absolute stunner. We can't get over the huge wrap-around verandah and alfresco deck which looks out to enchanting views over Bickley Valley. There's also plenty of lush gardens for everyone to explore, plus you're conveniently located near some beautiful trails if you venture a bit further. Our fave part though might just be the pizza oven outside.
